title: Hash error when trying to install or activate an environment
body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

Updated to spack to v0.15. Rewrote the environment to comply to the new format.  Tried to reinstall the environment and it fails part way through the installation of the environment.  At that point it also fails to activate the environment. 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
./scripts/install_lbann.sh -d
spack env create lbann-dev-power9le /tmp/tmp.sNWlgHKVtI
==> Updating view at /autofs/nccs-svm1_home1/vanessen/spack.git/var/spack/environments/lbann-dev-power9le/.spack-env/view
==> Created environment 'lbann-dev-power9le' in /autofs/nccs-svm1_home1/vanessen/spack.git/var/spack/environments/lbann-dev-power9le
==> You can activate this environment with:
==>   spack env activate lbann-dev-power9le
spack env activate -p lbann-dev-power9le
spack install
<some packages install>
...
==> Installing py-pytest
==> No binary for py-pytest found: installing from source
==> Fetching https://spack-llnl-mirror.s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/_source-cache/archive/1d/1d122e8be54d1a709e56f82e2d85dcba3018313d64647f38a91aec88c239b600.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> py-pytest: Executing phase: 'build'
==> py-pytest: Executing phase: 'install'
[+] /ccs/home/vanessen/spack_installed_packages/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-power9le/gcc-8.1.1/py-pytest-5.3.4-ln2l2mdp4jvtfctmfalqlzcjkomctj62
==> gcc@8.1.1 : has external module in ['gcc/8.1.1']
==> Error: '3easygztiqbtrszh4rxogt6wb5r7nvra'...
```
